article.title: Recommended titles on programming and software engineering

authorblurb.para: Centrum voor Wiskunde en Informatica, Amsterdam, The Netherlands

section.title: Introduction
section.para: Meta-Environment programmers have found the following titles interesting.

listitem.para: Alan Cooper, The Inmates are Running the Asylum: Why High Tech Products Drive Us Crazy and How To Restore The Sanity ,
K. Fogel, Producing Open Source Software -- How to Run a Successful Free Software Project, O"Reilly, 2006.
Andy Hunt, Dave Thomas, The Pragmatic Programmer -- Form Journeyman to Master, Addison-Wesley, 2000.
Steven McConnell, Code Complete, Second Edition, Microsoft Press, 2004. On Software Construction in general, on a low level of abstraction, full of best-practices and hard facts.
Barry J. Rosenberg , Spring into Technical Writing for Engineers and Scientists, Addison-Wesley, 2005. An efficient guide to writing manuals, papers and other professional documentation.
Andreas Zeller, Why Programs Fail -- A Guide to Systematic Debugging, Morgan Kaufmann, 2005.
